intro: Cynoglottis barrelieri subsp. barrelieri, commonly known as the Barrelier's cynoglottis, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and have a rough texture, while the flowers are small and yellow, arranged in dense clusters. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry woodland or savanna habitats.
